sentences: Steve Hansgen is an American musician from Washington, D.C.
section: N/A

sentences: He is best known as a member of the hardcore punk band Minor Threat.
section: N/A

sentences: He also played briefly in the D.C. hardcore band Government Issue, and joined Youth Brigade for their short reunion in 2012.
section: N/A

== Career == | === Early days and Minor Threat (1980–1983) ===

sentences: Hansgen became involved in the Washington, D.C. hardcore scene in the early 1980s.
section: == Career == | === Early days and Minor Threat (1980–1983) ===

sentences: He joined Minor Threat as bass guitarist in August 1982 when original bassist Brian Baker, Hansgen's childhood friend, switched to second guitar.
section: == Career == | === Early days and Minor Threat (1980–1983) ===

sentences: Hansgen appeared on the Out of Step LP and toured extensively with the band over the next year.
section: == Career == | === Early days and Minor Threat (1980–1983) ===

sentences: He left Minor Threat in 1983 when its founding members decided to return the band to its original configuration, a few months before their breakup.
section: == Career == | === Early days and Minor Threat (1980–1983) ===

sentences: They released the Security 12" record later this year.

sentences: In 1984, he was also a roadie for the reformed Meatmen.

sentences: In 2003, Baker and Hansgen began playing in the side project Middle Aged Brigade, with whom they recorded some demos.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: The band was active sporadically in the years that followed.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: In 2009, Steve Hansgen joined Mike Dolfi, Boyd Farrell (both from Black Market Baby) and Phil Ricche (of The Intentions) in the band Rustbuckit.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: On 29 December 2012, Hansgen reunited with three original members of the seminal DC hardcore band Youth Brigade, vocalist Nathan Strejcek (formerly of seminal band Teen Idles), drummer Danny Ingram and bassist Bert Quieroz for a show at the Washington, D.C. club The Black Cat.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: The show was a benefit for the D.C. hardcore documentary Salad Days and also featured Scream and Government Issue.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: That same foursome continued as Youth Brigade and did a second show at the 9:30 Club shortly thereafter as part of the "Punk-Funk Throwdown" series.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: Hansgen later played in Dot Dash.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: He has a wife that works in performing arts.
section: == Career == | === Middle Aged Brigade, Youth Brigade reunion, other later activity (2000–present) ===

sentences: Together they have one son.
